required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: E-Manage: A Brief mHelath Intervention for University Students
clinical_study.official_title: E-Manage: A Brief mHelath Intervention for University Students

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a two-part transdiagnostic psychological intervention aimed to help people respond to negative emotion and emotional distress in more adaptive ways using a technology called "ecological momentary intervention" (or EMI) that delivers intervention content using a smartphone app. Participants in this study will be Rutgers students recruited through-or currently affiliated with - Counseling, Alcohol and Other Drug Assistance Program & Psychiatric Services (CAPS) at Rutgers. Participants will first attend either one-on-one or group telehealth therapy sessions/workshops, where they will learn the therapeutic skills that are part of the study. Then, they will complete up to 8 weeks of smartphone monitoring that involves assessments and opportunities to practice the skills learned in therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in momentary levels of self-reported distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in momentary levels of suicidal thinking

arm_group.description: Participants will have up to three individual sessions with a study therapist. One or more treatment modules will be presented in each session.
Participants will have up to three group sessions with a study therapist. One or more treatment modules will be presented in each session.
Participants will have one workshop with a study therapist. All three treatment modules will be presented in one session.

intervention.description: Content of this intervention is based on pre-established transdiagnostic protocols for addressing the negative emotion associated with suicidal thoughts and behaviors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Age 18 years or older
- Matriculated at Rutgers during Fall of 2020 (on campus and/or remote)
- Currently residing in US
- Willingness to follow study requirements, as evidenced by an ability to provide written informed consent and read, understand, and complete the study procedures
- iOS and Android smartphone compatible with MetricWire. Nearly all phones since 2014 are compatible
Exclusion Criteria
- Non-English speaking
- Unable to understand or provide informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

facility.name: Rutgers Counseling, Alcohol and Other Drug Assistance Program & Psychiatric Services (CAPS)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

patient_data.ipd_description: We will share the informed consent and de-identified data.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: We will share the informed consent after the final participant has enrolled. We will share de-identified data one year after the study is finished.
